channel.title: Announcements
channel.description: Find out what's new at Curious Cosmos.

item.title: Proper themes for TTI
item.author: invalid@example.com (Cosmo)
item.dc:creator: Cosmo
item.content:encoded:
Hey guys,

I've changed the default theme to one that's a bit closer to how TTI used to look. We're using TARDIS blue as the primary accent and we've recovered the logo @Mop was originally using

There's a dark theme available also, and you can enable that using the theme selection menu in the footer:



Shoot me a private message or a chat on Discord if you have any problems.

item.title: TTI has a Discord server
item.author: invalid@example.com (Cosmo)
item.dc:creator: Cosmo
item.content:encoded:
To try and keep things somewhat uniform between TTI and Curious Cosmos, the chat feature here has been replaced with full Discord integration.

This integration will place TTI members in a "Members" group on the server, and there is a "Members Only" channel there if you want to keep discussions from being interrupted by random guests dropping in.

New threads, posts, and status updates will be broadcast to the #general channel as well

item.title: We're TTI again!
item.author: invalid@example.com (Cosmo)
item.dc:creator: Cosmo
item.content:encoded:
Hey guys!

As an addendum to my December 2017 update, I've spun the CuriousCosmos.com domain off into it's own new, fresh site.

This site is reverting back to the Time Travel Institute name, and will remain on xenForo indefinitely. I've reverted the categories to the way they were pre-September 2014 as well, and over time I'll move things back to their original places as time allows.

The reason we're doing this is two-fold:

1: I made a commitment...

We're TTI again!

item.title: Friday Chats on Curious Cosmos
item.author: invalid@example.com (Cosmo)
item.dc:creator: Cosmo
item.content:encoded:
Hey guys!

The chat feature here at TTI will remain, but future Friday Chats will occur on Curious Cosmos:
https://curiouscosmos.com/calendar/event/1-friday-night-chats/

Every Friday from 5 PM to 9 PM PST, all of our members (and guests!) are invited to join us in our Discord channel! As of now, there's not really a set topic. We'll discuss whatever comes up, and since you're on this site, we'll probably be able to think of something...

Friday Chats on Curious Cosmos

item.title: Friday Chats
item.author: invalid@example.com (Cosmo)
item.dc:creator: Cosmo
item.content:encoded:
Hey guys!

Starting this Friday, I'll be in the chatroom every week from 5PM to 9PM PST.

If anyone wants to chat about anything in particular, you're more than welcome to join me We're pretty quiet these days, but hopefully having a weekly time to hang out will help things grow and we can get things back on track!

There's no set topic, so we'll talk about whatever comes up.

item.title: Happy 2018!
item.author: invalid@example.com (Cosmo)
item.dc:creator: Cosmo
item.content:encoded:
I hope everyone has a great 2018!

This year we'll get things on track The TARDIS Project will get some momentum and we'll start filling the Resources and Media sections with some interesting stuff!

If anyone has any ideas or something they'd like to contribute, feel free to drop me.a PM.

Now, off to finish being sick (for my whole holiday break, lol) and to bring the New Year in in style.

item.title: Chatroom enabled
item.author: invalid@example.com (Cosmo)
item.dc:creator: Cosmo
item.content:encoded:
Hey everyone!

I've re-enabled the chatroom feature and it should be visible up there in the navigation tab:
https://curiouscosmos.com/chat/

We're still pretty slow, but I thought it was a good idea to put that back up anyways. I'll be in chat a couple times a day just to see if anything is happening, but will be posting a schedule showing when I'll be in there and available for extended periods of time

Right now I'm thinking Fridays from 5 to 8 PST, but we'll see what works...

Chatroom enabled

item.title: December 2017 update
item.author: invalid@example.com (Cosmo)
item.dc:creator: Cosmo
item.content:encoded:
Hey guys,

If you're reading this, you've no doubt noticed that we're no longer running Discourse. I've spent the last week or two getting everything back on xenForo, and xenForo is where we're going to stay.

When I bought the site from Mop in 2014, I promised to keep everything online because I believe that the threads we have here are a fascinating cross-section of internet culture. As a fan of "internet archeology", there's all sorts of interesting and fascinating things here that you...

December 2017 update

item.title: Guest posting enabled
item.author: invalid@example.com (Cosmo)
item.dc:creator: Cosmo
item.content:encoded:
Back in the Time Travel Institute days, the forums didn't require you to be registered in order to post. As far as I understand it, that's one of the reasons John Titor posted here in the first place.

Today, I've changed guest permissions so that visitors may create threads or reply to posts without needing to sign up. We're about discussion and discovery here, so those who are also looking for community are free to sign up and establish themselves here. If you just want to add something to...

Guest posting enabled

item.title: Time Travel Institute's Content Policy
item.author: invalid@example.com (Cosmo)
item.dc:creator: Cosmo
item.content:encoded:
Time Travel Institute is a place to discuss, connect, and share in an open environment. The nature of this content might be funny, serious, offensive, or anywhere in between. While participating, it’s important to keep in mind this value above all others: show enough respect to others so that we all may continue to enjoy Time Travel Institute for what it is.

Unwelcome Content

While Time Travel Institute provides a lot of leeway in what content is acceptable, here are...

Time Travel Institute's Content Policy

item.title: Site Outage
item.author: invalid@example.com (Mop)
item.dc:creator: Mop
item.content:encoded:
OK, so that was fun. The site's been down since Tuesday night. We're back online now. The problem wasn't TTI but rather another site we host and operate on the same VPS. Regardless, it's something to think about. It's a reminder that come December 31, there will be no more TTI. So prepare accordingly. Make sure your survival kits are fully stocked.

Mop

item.title: The End of Time Travel Institute?
item.author: invalid@example.com (Mop)
item.dc:creator: Mop
item.content:encoded:
It's ironic, I feel, that a web site dedicated to time travel would ever see an end, but it seems that we've come to that point. I've grown old and tired, and can no longer dedicate to this organization the energy that is required of me. Let's be honest with ourselves: It's been clear that this has the case for many years. I feel it is time to end my participation in the Time Travel Institute. That does not necessarily mean the end of the Time Travel Institute, though. Here's what I'm...

The End of Time Travel Institute?

item.title: New poll at TTI!
item.author: invalid@example.com (Mop)
item.dc:creator: Mop
item.content:encoded:
John sent me an e-mail and suggested a new poll question, so we've posted a new poll.

Vote here: http://www.xone.net/tti/polls/

Mop

item.title: The old messages... on their way back.
item.author: invalid@example.com (Mop)
item.dc:creator: Mop
item.content:encoded:
Hi guys,

I'm here to give you a heads up on what's going on with the old messages. So far, I've recovered them, so they're safe and sound. Now I have to figure out how to format them so that they're usable and presentable. But let's be clear about some things:

- You will be able to read the messages
- You will NOT be able to reply to the old messages
- You will NOT be able to post new messages in the old format (the old format is gone... kiss it good-bye)

I'm giving you advance warning...

The old messages... on their way back.

item.title: Added a new link to the TTI Links section
item.author: invalid@example.com (Mop)
item.dc:creator: Mop
item.content:encoded:
This one's kinda cool. It's call the Anachronia Time Travel Agency. I think the name says it all.

Thanks,
Mop
The Time Travel Institute

item.title: Some new books have been recommended four our Campus Store
item.author: invalid@example.com (Mop)
item.dc:creator: Mop
item.content:encoded:
Bruce Sommer recommended the Time Wars series by Simon Hawke so we've added those books to the Campus Store at TTI.

Thanks (especially to Bruce),
Mop

item.title: Finally fixed the friggin' banners!
item.author: invalid@example.com (Mop)
item.dc:creator: Mop
item.content:encoded:
The TTI banners were never loading correctly. Had to do with an upload issue (just upload in Binary, dammit...). Oh, well. Whatever. The banners have been corrected. If you want to download them, get 'em here.

Mop

item.title: We're SciFi.com site of the week!!!
item.author: invalid@example.com (Mop)
item.dc:creator: Mop
item.content:encoded:
We're SciFi.com site of the week!!!

The Time Travel Institute is Sci-Fi Site of the Week! Yay!

http://www.scifi.com/sfw/issue111/site.html

Mop

item.title: I've added a poll to the TTI web page
item.author: invalid@example.com (Mop)
item.dc:creator: Mop
item.content:encoded:
I've added a poll to the TTI web page

We'll start simple and work our way from there. Right now, the question is "Do you believe that time travel is possible?".

Thanks,
Mop

item.title: We've added new books to the Campus Store
item.author: invalid@example.com (Mop)
item.dc:creator: Mop
item.content:encoded:
We've added several new books to the Campus Store at TTI, including some great science fiction (The Time Ships by Stephen Baxter, A World Out of Time by Larry Niven, and more), several books researching the events at Montauk, some books touching on the Philadelphia Experiment, and Stephen Hawking's A Brief History of Time.

All books can be found by dropping by our Campus Store.

Thanks!
Mop

item.title: We're using new banner code - Any bugs to report?
item.author: invalid@example.com (Mop)
item.dc:creator: Mop
item.content:encoded:
Hi!

We're using new banner code for the advertising banners at the top of the web page. It's suppose to permit "rich media" (Java, Enliven, etc.). Has anyone encounter problems with this (perhaps the whole page did not load, etc.)?

Let us know by posting any details you can (or e-mail us at webmaster@xone.net with "Bug" as subject line if you can't post).

Thanks!
Mop,
the Admin

item.title: Moving messages over from MessageZone
item.author: invalid@example.com (Mop)
item.dc:creator: Mop
item.content:encoded:
Hi all!

Well, MessageZone is finally up so I'm going to be moving the messages over from there to here now. Please bare with me. There are many messages and I'm going to be moving them one at a time.

Thank you,
Mop,
the Admin
